items.title: Vance Flexes the Marines’ Might as Thousands Protest Trump’s Agenda
items.summary: Vice President JD Vance’s trip to a military base in California illustrated rising tensions between the federal government and Democratic leaders.

items.title: Woman Who Tried to Blame Twin for Fatal Buggy Crash Sentenced to 4 Years
items.summary: The crash killed two Amish children and injured two others in rural Minnesota in 2023.

items.title: White House and Government Agencies Join Bluesky, Then Attack Democrats
items.summary: The Health and Human Services and Homeland Security Departments were among the agencies posting messages that blamed Democrats for the federal shutdown.

items.title: Jury Awards $19.7 Million to 6 Bystanders in Denver Police Shooting
items.summary: The bystanders were injured when a Denver police officer fired, while facing a crowd of people, at an armed man outside a bar in 2022.

items.title: Case Against Bolton Raises Questions Over Justice Dept.’s Use of Espionage Act
items.summary: The allegations in his case are a pointed example of when classified information tumbles into nonsecure places, either by accident or from recklessness by someone trusted to keep it safe.

items.title: U.S. Is Repatriating Survivors of Its Strike on Suspected Drug Vessel
items.summary: Two men rescued by the U.S. military after it attacked a boat in the Caribbean Sea were being sent to their home countries of Colombia and Ecuador, President Trump said.

items.title: California governor says Trump ‘putting ego over responsibility’ as military show shuts highway
items.summary: <p>Gavin Newsom says safety concerns forced state officials to close a portion of the busy Interstate 55 on Saturday</p><p>The California governor, Gavin Newsom, has accused Donald Trump of “putting his ego over responsibility” over a military showcase that involved firing live artillery shells over a major highway in the state’s south.</p><p>Newsom said safety concerns over the event forced state officials to close a portion of the busy Interstate 5 near the US Marine Camp Pendleton base on Saturday.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/18/california-highway-closure-military-celebration">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Trump news at a glance: Inflatable costumes aplenty as millions march against president
items.summary: <p>Republicans mostly silent as protesters turn out in every state to peacefully reject authoritarianism in No Kings rallies. Key US politics stories from Saturday 18 October at a glance</p><p>Americans in every state <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/18/no-kings-protests-events-states">marched in protest</a> against the Trump administration, giving voice to concerns that the country is sliding into authoritarianism.</p><p>Millions turned out nationwide with signs, marching bands, a huge banner with the US constitution’s preamble that people could sign, and inflatable costumes ranging from bananas to SpongeBob SquarePants to frogs, which have in particular emerged as a sign of resistance beginning in Portland, Oregon.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/19/trump-briefing-news-at-a-glance-latest">Continue reading...</a>
